intro: Elleanthus flavescens, commonly known as the yellow flax, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its yellowish-green flowers and linear leaves. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and thrives in full sun. It is known for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in gardens. Elleanthus flavescens is also used in traditional medicine for its potential health benefits.
